title: How does the expenditure on long term support differ by setting and age?
analysis_commentary:
40% (£5.2b) of expenditure on long term support is spent on residential care: £2.1b on those aged 18-64 and the remaining £3b on people aged 65 plus. For those aged 65+, 20% of the total long term support expenditure is spent on each community home care and nursing. For those aged 18-64, more money is spent on support living (£1.1b) and via direct payments (£944k).

This is quite an abstract measure and gives no indication of need or resultant outcomes in the local population.
data_source: Health & social care information centre, Personal Social Services Expenditure and Unit Costs
